intro: Lonchitis zahlbruckneri, commonly known as the Zahner's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. It is adapted to thrive in moist, disturbed habitats such as riverbanks and forest edges.
